SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Sinoso noyno kotowa noko gac?
Kowo soyo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Ah, I see. That must be the language
of this world. Thankfully, it's nothing
a little magic can't handle!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_060.text:
Loud and clear now! I've never used translation
magic before, but it's working like a charm
because I'm just that good.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Be welcome in this land,
Soyay the Pollinator,
for we have summoned you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Um. I mean, I can hear the words you're
saying, but they don't make a lot of
sense in that particular order.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 40,846th
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_091.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_091.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, Soyay the Pollinator,
to guide the Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Hey, sure! I'll guide the Epuyke's maiden!
Two questions first: What's an Epuyke,
and what's its maiden supposed to do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_110.text:
The Epuyke is the blossom which gives life
to all that is in this world—and the maiden
is she who keeps the Epuyke alive. If the Epuyke does not blossom, all life
will wither and fade. To prevent this fate,
the maiden must cause it to bloom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_120.text:
And it is you, the Soyay,
who guides the Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_130.text:
You sure about putting such an important
job in the hands of somebody who just
wandered in from another world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. But this is not something you need understand.
All that is asked of you is to guide the
Epuyke's maiden. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_150.text:
You probably aren't thinking about what
might happen if I fail or decide to quit
this gig partway through, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_170.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_170.text:
Well, I'm guessing this Epuyke maiden is
going to be how I find my cat, so I might
as well get this show on the road.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_180.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_180.text:
Now let's go meet a maiden!
My green lines should take me there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome! Welcome to Dura Village,
Soyay the Pollinator! We have been eagerly
awaiting your arrival. Please, come this way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Wow, seems like being a Soyay
is a pretty big deal around here.
I'm actually a little nervous now...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_030.text:
So you're the Epuyke's maiden, eh?
Well never fear, 'cause I'm gonna be
the best guide a girl could ask for!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Yes, I am Lela, the Epuyke's maiden
for this season. I have been waiting for a Soyay to accompany
me through my trials, for it is said that
when maiden and Soyay overcome such together,
the Epuyke will endure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_050.text: Trials, huh? Anything I can help with?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_060.text:
The Epuyke ritual for the previous season has
already ended, and what time remains is short.
I apologize for having you set out so soon
after your arrival, but you must leave now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Lela's mother—and I am delighted beyond
words that a maiden of Epuyke has been
chosen from my bloodline. Once Lela blooms into the Epuyke flower,
our family will at last be secure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_090.text: Hold on, did you say she's gonna bloom into the Epuyke? Is that part of the whole Epuyke life cycle or something?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Yes. The maiden of the Epuyke becomes
the Epuyke flower. That is my role.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_110.text:
And you just, like, accept that?
It's a totally normal thing here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_120.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_120.text:
Normal? Goodness, no! To become the Epuyke
is an indescribable honor that my family—
my daughter—has been chosen for.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_130.text:
You come from a different world, Soyay, so I
know this must all seem quite strange to you.
But the Epuyke will blossom soon, and I trust
you will understand when you see it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_140.text:
Go forth now, Soyay, and cultivate
my daughter into a beautiful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_150.text:
Well, I suppose you people are this world
in the same way us witches are Pulchra,
so I'll go out there and do my best!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_160.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_160.text:
We have no time for idling, Soyay.
We must depart at once.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_170.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_100_CUT_000_170.text:
May all luck be with you, Lela.
Go forth proudly for the sake
of our family and our lineage.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_000.text:
I look forward to traveling with you
and completing the trials, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_010.text:
Me too! So hey, tell me about your world.
Like, where would you go to find a cat,
for starters?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_020.text:
I know not of cats. In this world, we have
the god of the Imeru, the god of the Kikir,
and the evil Ancikar. Do these 'cats' have
anything to do with my trials?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_030.text:
Er, no? To be honest, I came here to find
a cat, and was planning to hightail it
outta here as soon as I found one.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_040.text:
Sorry. That probably isn't much encouragement.
But don't worry! I know there's a good reason
why I've been chosen to be your Soyay!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_050.text:
I tried to picture what my Soyay might be
like after I was chosen to be the maiden,
but you are far, far different from
anything I ever imagined. That said, I do not feel nervous.
It is all simply...strange.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_060.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_060.text:
But if this cat you are searching for
happens to be Ancikar, it might prevent
me from blossoming into the Epuyke.
This would be a very sad thing indeed.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_070.text:
I get that you're not afraid of returning
to the earth, but you clearly really WANT
to be this Epuyke. Mind sharing why?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_080.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_080.text:
The souls of all maidens who bloom into the
Epuyke live forever in the Maiden's Garden,
which is said to be a place of great joy. But I care not what sort of place
it might be; I care only that I will
finally see my Ahpe there again.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_100.text:
Ahpe is my only friend—one who is
undergoing preparations to bloom
into the Epuyke as we speak. The people claim she will no longer be Ahpe once
she becomes the Epuyke, but I do not believe this.
Ahpe will always be Ahpe—and when she blooms,
her soul will live on in the Maiden's Garden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_110.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_110.text:
I have been alone since she left, and...
I miss her. So please guide me well,
that I might bloom into the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_120.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_000_120.text:
Gotcha. And don't worry, Lela—
I'm gonna be an AMAZING guide!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_020_000.text:
Dreams of Ancikar—the evil who
slumbers deep within the earth—
have influenced this fiend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_020_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_020_010.text:
Ancikar's dreams appear as fiends
during times of flood, but in times of
drought they appear as eggs instead. While we could easily crush the eggs,
none among us bother to do so,
for it is far simpler to just not travel
during times of flood.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_020_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_020_020.text:
Ancikar's fiends play an
important role, you see.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_000.text:
I feel powerful energy from that plant.
Is it the Epuyke?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_010.text:
It is indeed the great blossom that brings our
worlds together—and it is also my friend Ahpe.
She has been reborn as the Epuyke, and will
become a bloom of great beauty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_020.text:
So that's Ahpe, huh? I can't wait to see how 
she blooms! That said, the fact she sprouted
right after that fight feels pretty convenient.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_030.text:
That is the job of Ancikar's fiends.
When a fiend dies, Ancikar's dreams—
which birthed said fiends—are absorbed
by the Epuyke. The Epuyke then takes Ancikar's dreams,
converts them to nutrients, and grows.
In this way are we kept safe from Ancikar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_040.text:
So the more fiends we kill, the bigger 
the Epuyke grows? Neat! Let's get killin'!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_050.text:
Yes. But if Ahpe's Epuyke grows too fast,
I will not be ready—for I must complete
my trials before it blossoms for Ahpe.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_060.text:
So it's my job to get you through
your trials while Ahpe grows?
Ha ha ha! Man, this is wild.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_070.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_070.text:
To think one would find the role of a
Soyay funny... You are indeed much
different than I imagined.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_080.text:
I mean, if I gotta do it, I may as well enjoy
myself, right? Oh, but don't worry—I promise
that I'm taking all of this stuff SUPER seriously.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_090.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DORA_110_CUT_030_090.text:
Worry not—each Soyay has their own way
of thinking and doing. I ask only that
you guide me true along my trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Have you come to understand the Epuyke's
maiden a little better now, Soyay?
Are you ready to fulfill your role?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You bet I am! Once I take on a job,
I see it through to the bitter end.
Now bring on the trials, the Ancikar,
the whatever! I'm ready for it all!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
It is unusual to see a Soyay so
eager to take on their role! But resolution is not enough to lead the
Epuyke's maiden—you also need strength.
I ask that you show this to me now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
When your heart is truly close to the
Epuyke's maiden, only then will you
display your true strength as Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak of the present Epuyke,
who I hear was once your friend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
My apologies. I meant no offense. Ahpe's Soyay brilliantly overcame all
trials, which is why she bloomed into such
a healthy Epuyke. I only pray your Soyay
performs so admirably, Lela.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Right, enough pomp and circumstance.
Tell me what I've gotta do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text: You must locate a fiend and kill it— but a fiend that is not one of Ancikar's. You must find the fiend, Soyay. This is a part of your trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text:
Never have I seen a Soyay so arrogant!
But go then, Soyay the Pollinator,
and guide well our maiden of Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Is this truly the place, Soyay?
I see nothing here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Oh yeah. The fiend we need to best
will be riiight around here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
I am the summoner of the strength fiends—
and I am surprised the two of you
discovered me so quickly.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If I may ask a question, Summoner?
I understand why the Soyay must fight,
but what meaning does the act hold
for a maiden like myself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Once you witness the Soyay fighting,
you will understand in due course.
Do you stand ready, Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Then I shall summon the fiend.
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
One fiend's butt found and kicked!
That means I win, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Thanks, but the Epuyke hasn't changed.
Wasn't it supposed to grow or something
once I killed a fiend?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
This fiend was not born from Ancikar's dreams,
but summoned by the god of the Kikir from a world
beyond—summoned with the same power the god
of the Imeru uses to call Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
We Kikir use this power to fight Ancikar's
dream creatures, and have lost warriors
beyond counting in our battle for this land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
You have displayed the strength needed to draw
close to the Epuyke's maiden's heart, Soyay.
But tell me, Lela: what did you feel when you
witnessed the Soyay in battle?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
At first, I was afraid, my thoughts
dominated by what might happen
to me if the Soyay were to fail.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
But as I watched her desperate battle,
I found myself wishing for her victory—
not for my own sake, but because I simply
wanted to see her win. And when she finally proved victorious,
my heart overflowed with joy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
I have been alone ever since Ahpe became
the Epuyke. But now, I am not; I can walk
forward proudly beside the Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke:
I hereby deem you worthy to proceed
to the Trial of Love. I pray you will become our Epuyke, and ask
Soyay the Pollinator to guide you well.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Lela, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
We Kikir, fellow residents of this world,
offer the Trial of Love to judge if you are
worthy to become the next season's Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Love? Ooo, sounds spicy!
So what do I do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_030.text:
You must plant vine seeds within
the holes upon the plateau.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Small fiends of Ancikar may appear.
Defeat them to fertilize the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_050.text:
If the maiden holds true love in her heart,
the seeds will immediately germinate
and grow into mighty vines.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_060.text:
And if they do not? Does this mean
I lack love and am not an appropriate
choice for the Epuyke's maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Love

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Aw, you'll be fine, girl!
No reason to assume you'll fail
before you even try, you know?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_090.text:
While I leave the decision of where to plant
the seeds to you, bear in mind these vines
will help our people move from place to place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_100.text:
How fine it will be to move between
plateaus without encountering fiends
during times of flood!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_140.text:
You need not strain your
mental faculties, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_150.text:
We said, 'May the Epuyke blossom
be protected.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_160.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_160.text:
Again, I pray for your success in
this trial. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_000.text:
There's a hole for seeds here.
How about it?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_010.text: Let us plant the seeds here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_010.text:
Is my heart truly loving enough?
What if I fail?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_020.text:
We'll know after the trial!
Oh, and here. Take the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_050.text:
Okay, the witness said little fiends of
Ancikar should be popping up now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_020_000.text: These fiends act as nutrition for the seeds, which means they should be sprouting now. Buuut...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_000.text:
Oh, look! They sprouted!
See? Told you you'd be okay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_010.text:
It seems I have love in my heart after all.
But answer me this, Soyay the Pollinator:
do you have a name?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_020.text:
Of course I do! I'm Ameya Aisling.
But you can call me Ameya or Soyay—
either way is good with this witch!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Lela, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_010.text:
In this trial, you must collect fragments of
the Epuyke Tablet which have been scattered
across the land, put them back together,
and decipher the tale written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Both tablet and tale are said to have been
created for the Epuyke's maiden by the god
of the Imeru—and to be the physical form
of Ancikar's dreams.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_030.text:
The maiden, upon blooming into the Epuyke,
is no longer a person. She becomes more
akin to a god—to a part of this earth. This trial is a test to see if
you possess the wisdom needed
to become a part of the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Ahpe—I mean, the current Epuyke
collected these fragments as well,
did she not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Ah, but she did more than simply collect
the fragments—she assembled the tablet,
deciphered the tale, and bloomed into
the Epuyke without being led astray. You have little time left,
Maiden Lela. Use it well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_060.text:
We don't know where the fragments
are or how many we're looking for,
so I assume that's all part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Precisely so, Soyay.
Now go lead the maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_000.text:
This must be a fragment of the Epuyke Tablet.
There is something carved into it—writing,
perhaps? I fear I'll not be able to decipher
this even when fully assembled...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Hey, if Ahpe read it,
that means you can too!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Yes, I suppose you're right. Regardless,
it's probably best to save such worries
until we have the tablet fully assembled.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Makes you wonder who even wrote
this thing, am I right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of
the Epuyke Tablet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_010.text:
Do these things just pop out from the
ground whenever a new maiden is chosen?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_020.text:
I am not certain; this is my first time
seeing them for myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_030.text:
Wait, you've never seen any of
the old Epuyke Tablets before?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_040.text:
Never. And now that I think on it,
I have never met another who has,
either. I wonder why that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of
the Epuyke Tablet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_010.text:
Man, it has a super weird texture...
Not stone or wood, I know that much.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_020.text:
It feels the same as the
husks of our birth seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_030.text: Wait, you guys are born from SEEDS?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_000.text: That should be all of them.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder what it says—but if only the
Epuyke Maiden can read it, I suppose
it must be special to her.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_020.text:
Ahpe read the tablet and became the Epuyke,
so the actual meaning matters very little.
I merely need to read it and bloom into
the Epuyke, as she did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_030.text:
Let us return to the Witness to Wisdom
and assemble this as best we can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Lela, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_020.text:
How strange... I do not know this writing,
but when I put it together, I can read it.
I believe I am closer to the Epuyke now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_030.text:
Take whatever time you need to read it.
That'll bring you closer to Ahpe.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, but this is impossible! I am not meant
to be the Epuyke's maiden! I will never see
my beloved Ahpe again! I will be alone until
my foliage withers and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Lela—but you
must not give up. All is according to the will
of the Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_020.text:
Listen to the witness! She's seen a ton
of maidens come and go, so you'll be fine.
Also, didn't I tell you I'd make absolutely
certain you become the Epuyke?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_000.text:
I did it! I read it!
Now I can finally meet Ahpe!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_010.text:
Oh man, that's a happy smile!
Guess the message was good?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_020.text:
It was from Ahpe—she's waiting for me at the
Maiden's Garden! She even wrote about a secret
only she and I know, so it HAS to be from her! Oh, but I am so happy! I'm going to bloom
into a beautiful Epuyke and see her again!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_030.text:
Er, but the souls of the maidens that become
the Epuyke are supposed to return to the earth,
which means this Maiden's Garden place shouldn't
actually exist... But I suppose there's no proof of that,
so probably best to keep my trap shut.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_050.text:
With its role fulfilled, the tablet crumbles
to dust so none but the maiden might know
its tale. Such is the will of the Imeru's god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_060.text:
Hear me, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_020.text:
It detailed all that has come to pass,
and all that is yet to come. Indeed,
I feel it is some manner of prophecy. But I also fear it might come across
in a negative way were I to speak of it,
so I think it best that I keep the
details to myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Lela,
next Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_010.text:
We wish for you to bloom
just as beautifully.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_020.text: So Ahpe did it. She became the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Ahpe! It's me, Lela!
Can you see me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_040.text:
That is but the Epuyke, Lela.
The one who was called Ahpe is no more.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Don't worry about it, Lela—you know
the Epuyke and Ahpe WAY better than
these people here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_060.text:
I suggest you choose your words
more carefully, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Yeah, that's right! I'M the Soyay here!
And since witches don't believe in gods,
I don't care about your god's guidance! Also, since I'm the Soyay, I plan to keep
going through these trials with Lela.
Anybody got a problem with that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_080.text: Of course not. Thank you, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_090.text:
We are beginning the Epuyke festival.
The Epuyke's pollen will now rain down
upon the earth, and we grant you special
permission to acquire it for yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Now go, before the Kikir
collect it all.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_000.text:
The Epuyke bloomed again this season!
We're getting our pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_010.text:
You make it sound like it
just appeared randomly.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
What, would you rather we talk
like we grew it ourselves?

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Another season, another successful
Epuyke festival.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_020.text:
You know this is all thanks to
the maiden's hard work, right?

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_030.text:
I only hope I can get through
this without issue.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_000.text:
The Epuyke's pollen! Hooray!
We get our nutrients from this!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_010.text:
So tasty! Epuyke forever!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_020.text:
I wonder if the evil deity, Ancikar,
truly does slumber underground.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_030.text:
We'd find out if the Epuyke died,
I guess—although that would mean
even bigger problems for us.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_040.text:
Yes, I suppose the only ones who know for
certain are those in the Maiden's Garden.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_000.text:
Eee hee hee! Festival time!
Epuyke pollen time!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_010.text:
The Kikir LOVE Epuyke pollen!
Yummy yummy!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_020.text:
Is it really that tasty?
I'm sorta curious to try it...

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_030.text:
Do not. Though its form may have changed,
this pollen was once the dreams of evil Ancikar.
If ingested you will become unable to live without it,
just like these Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_020.text: Yes, I am in the middle of my trials.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_030.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_030.text:
Please bloom into a beautiful Epuyke
and feed us more delicious pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_150_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_150_CUT_000_010.text:
Yummy, yummy! Such full tummy!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_010.text:
There is little pollen left on the Epuyke.
All that remains is for it to wither,
decay, and become one with the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_020.text: The Epuyke has little time remaining.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_030.text:
This means the ritual for the maiden
to bloom into the next Epuyke will
begin very soon.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_040.text:
We pray you might safely complete your
trials and blossom into an Epuyke that
rivals the one of this season.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_050.text:
Needless to say, I will do
all within my power.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_060.text:
You show promise, Maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Lela!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
The Epuyke has bloomed and withered.
Its soul has returned to the earth,
and now watches over and protects us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_020.text:
And since the Epuyke absorbed Ancikar's
fell magic before it returned to the earth,
we now enjoy this brief moment of peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Alas, this is naught but a junction.
Maiden, the time has come for you
to be reborn anew into the Epuyke.
The time has come for the ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_050.text: Am I going to see Ahpe, Ameya?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_090.text:
The maiden has been reborn
as the Epuyke's seed.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_110.text:
This is your final task, Soyay the Pollinator:
you must plant the Epuyke's seed in the earth.
Send it to Ancikar, that it might trap the wicked
god in slumber. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_000.text:
It's so weird to think we were together
when we planted the vine seeds... No. You're here with me now,
and you're gonna be with me forever.
You'll never be alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 40,846th Soyay the Pollinator.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_030.text:
Hey, uh, do you think I could stay until
Lela—I mean, the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as
if for their very lives. I see now which
manner of Soyay you are.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_050.text:
I mean, I know I only came here to look
for my cat, but now I feel like I have to
see this all the way through.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely a woman.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
40,847th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_070.text:
That must mean you've picked
the next maiden, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_080.text:
You are no longer Soyay the Pollinator.
Such matters do not concern you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_090.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_090.text:
Gotcha! New maiden needs a new Soyay.
I'll keep my snoot outta your biz.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 40,846th Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_000.text:
Your flower is so, SO pretty, Lela...
It's every bit as pretty as Ahpe's!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_020.text: Oh my gosh! You can hear me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_040.text:
Girl, you are SO beautiful.
I'm tearing up just looking at you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_080.text: ...I guess she can't hear me anymore.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_090.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_090.text:
She has gone to the Maiden's Garden,
as is right and proper.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.text:
See, Lela? This is your pollen.
And since I was your Soyay,
I'm going to take it with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Hiya! I'm Ameya Aisling, and I'm
looking for a cat. Seen one around?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Yeah, but I WASN'T summoned.
I chose to come here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Pardon us. It seems none of what
we said got through to you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Seems like language isn't the
only barrier here...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_090.text:
Doesn't seem like you give two
toots about what I have to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_100.text:
Okay, whatever. I'm just going to guess my
cat's somewhere this way and roll with it.
So what do you want me to do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Guide? Sure, but I just got here.
You really want someone like me
taking care of that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_150.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_150.text:
Your god's pretty irresponsible if they
leave something like this to an outsider.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_170.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_170.text:
Anyway, I guess I should find the maiden
and kick this all off—especially if it leads
me to my kitty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Doroso Village,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_010.text: Hi! Are you the Epuyke's maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_020.text:
No. I am Kup, younger sister to this
year's maiden, Chup. My sister—

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Her sister does not WANT to be
the stupid Maiden of the Epuyke,
thank you very much. Look, you're the Soyay, right? How about you
just get me out of here and take me back
to whatever world you came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_040.text:
Yikes! Is being the maiden
really that awful?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_050.text:
But we must have a maiden, Sister!
Elsewise the land will wither away!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I would love to, Sister—AND I'd do a
much better job than you! But I can't,
because the markings of the Imeru
are already on you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_080.text:
This year's Epuyke is already budding!
If you don't do your part as the maiden,
we're all going to die!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_090.text:
Meh, who cares? If we die, all the
clerics in the city will just say,
'This, too, is fate!' or whatever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_100.text:
Why are you ALWAYS like this, Chup!?
You run around doing whatever you want,
which means I have to behave like a
good girl because you NEVER do! IT'S NOT FAAAIR! WAAAAAAH!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_120.text:
Ugh. Fiiine. Whatever. I'll do it.
Sheesh! I just wanted to give her
a bit of a hard time, but then she
started crying and made it weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Come on then, Soyay.
Let's go do the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_140.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_140.text:
Okay, Kup, I'm off to do the trials,
but I don't know if it'll go well—and
to be honest, I still had lots of things
I wanted to do in life. Happy now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_160.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_160.text:
Okay, so some ladies earlier said I have to
guide you, but I don't know what that means.
Do I just follow you on trials or whatever?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_170.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_170.text:
Tradition says the Maiden of the Epuyke must
walk with the Soyay. As she does, she finds her
resolve to become the Epuyke by completing
trials of strength, wisdom, and love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_190.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_190.text:
Oh, that's something all Imeru know.
Sis is just...special.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_210.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_210.text:
Uh-uh, lady! No way! My name's Chup,
and you don't get to call me 'Sis!'
...Only Kup can call me that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_220.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_220.text:
Please, Sis! You have to formally
request the Soyay's help!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_230.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_230.text:
Fine, whatever. Please help me,
O great Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_000.text:
Man, no matter what argument we're
having, once she busts out the tears
it's my loss. It's always been like that,
ever since we were little.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_010.text:
And now, for some who-knows-why reason,
I'm this season's Maiden of the Epuyke
even though my earnest little sister
would be WAY better at it! Sucks for you having to be
the Soyay in my season.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_020.text:
Yeah, well, it's not like I WANTED
to be the Soyay—I just ended up here.
So I guess we're in the same boat.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_030.text: Wait, so I'm the one in trouble here!? Well in that case, I'm glad it's me here instead of my little sister. I mean, not that any of it matters; this Epuyke festival is probably the last one anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Which means the world
is gonna end, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_050.text:
Probably? I don't really know the details;
it's the god of the Imeru who picks the
Maiden and the Soyay and all that. All I know is that I don't want to make
my sister cry again, so you better do
your damn job properly, lady!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_060.text:
Normally, I'd tell you not to worry and that
you could count on me, but I have no idea
what I'm doing here. Er, do YOU know, Chup?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_070.text:
Ugh, this is just the worst.
You're the Soyay, remember?
It's YOUR job to lead ME. Anyway, the trials. There are three of
them, so please just...do your job.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Answer me, Maiden! Do you understand
why Soyay the Pollinator must now face
the Trial of Strength?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Yeah, it's because I can't fight—but I
don't get why that means she has to.
I mean, all I have to do here is turn
into the Epuyke, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
In order to bloom into the Epuyke, you must
defeat Ancikar's fiends. If the current Epuyke
does not blossom, it means the next maiden
will never take her rightful place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Which means I'll stay the maiden forever
and never become the Epuyke...which I
wouldn't mind, if we're being honest.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
If the Epuyke does not blossom, we will never
receive its pollen. We Kikir toil day in and day
out so we might receive this gift, and it is the
duty of the maiden and Soyay to make it so!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
So she doesn't do it for herself, got it.
Anyway, that's enough talk—let's get this
trial of strength started already.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text: You must locate a fiend and kill it— but a fiend that is not one of Ancikar's. You must find the fiend, Soyay. This is a part of your trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Wow, someone's confident.
Hope that's justified.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_1.text:
And now, Soyay the Pollinator,
guide well the Maiden of the Epuyke!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, we're at a big empty spot.
What do I do now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Nothing. You're fine. The fiend we're
supposed to kill is gonna be here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
I am the summoner of the Fiend of Strength,
and am glad the two of you discovered me.
Now watch as I bring forth the fiend into
this world!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text: Hey. Is this really going to be okay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, Epuyke nogonoa kowo,
I guess?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text: That's one Trial of Strength done!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
You have done well in the Trial of Strength,
Maiden, and I pray you might bloom into a
beautiful Epuyke. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
Wait, is that really it?
I mean, uh, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Chup, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in
the holes upon the plateaus.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Small fiends of Ancikar may appear—defeat them
to fertilize the seeds. If the maiden holds true
love in her heart, the seeds will immediately
germinate and grow into mighty vines.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_020.text:
So we're spreading vine seeds?
What's so romantic about that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_030.text:
The vines that grow will aid you
and all the people. This is love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_040.text: Yeaaah, sorry, but I don't really have love in my heart—and I absolutely don't want or need to help 'the people.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_060.text:
I just don't need this creep pushing a bunch
of stupid charity work on me when I'm already
busy trying not to make my sister cry!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Take the seeds of the transport vines,
and know I will pray for you to safely
overcome your trial. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Man, the people out here aren't
very good listeners, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_000_000.text:
This looks like a seed hole.
You like this one, Chup?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
Look, let's just throw the seeds on the
ground and let 'em grow on their own.
That's what seeds do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_010.text:
But the witness said they need nutrients.
Like, a fiend's supposed to appear or
something, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
Seeds planted, fiends killed.
That should cause it to sprout.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_210_CUT_030_000.text:
Am I one of these vines?
Or am I a fiend of Ancikar?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you understand what this
trial entails, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_020.text:
Um... You're gonna give me a test
to see how smart I am?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Our intelligence is nothing in comparison
to the god of the Imeru. No, the wisdom
asked of you here will determine if you
can reflect upon yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_040.text:
I sense confusion in your mien,
so permit me to explain. In this trial, you must collect fragments of
the Epuyke Tablet which have been scattered
across the land, put them back together,
and decipher the tale written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_070.text:
And I can understand the tale
if I'm wise enough?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Precisely so—for only the Epuyke's
maiden can decipher the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_090.text:
We don't know where the fragments are
or how many we're looking for, so I assume
that's all part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_100.text:
These are answers you know well, Soyay,
for this is what it means to be you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_130.text:
I always get tongue-tied saying this,
but...Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of the Epuyke Tablet,
but I have ZERO idea what it says.
...Does that mean I'm stupid?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_010.text:
You've probably gotta put all of 'em
together before it makes sense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_020.text:
Okay, whew! I was worried for
a hot second there. But CAN I put them together, though?
And can I even FIND all the fragments
since my Soyay is so...you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_030.text: C'mon, I'm doing my best here!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, I'm sorry. I mean, my sister and I have
special memories of this place, but there's
no way you'd have known that. Honestly, the fact you even found it
probably proves you're a decent Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_050.text:
You have special memories
of this place?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Yeah, it was a popular place to search for
pretty rocks when we were kids—we used
to run around looking for these big, shiny
pieces of crystal. ...And whenever my sister found one,
I would take it and claim it for myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I really am a terrible person...
But I guess that doesn't matter now,
because my memories will all vanish
as soon as I become the Epuyke...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Whoops! Man, listen to me!
Talking like my becoming the
Epuyke is guaranteed to happen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_010.text:
So do these things just pop out from the
ground whenever a new maiden is chosen?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_020.text:
I guess so? I mean, you never see them,
and it's not like anyone's come up and
shown me one either.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Okay, so they're born JUST to
be found by the maidens?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_040.text: No way it'd be that convenient.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_050.text:
Y'know, I come here by myself sometimes
to take in the view of the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_060.text:
I've always wondered what it feels like to
turn into the Epuyke, but I never thought
I'd...you know. Find out for myself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_070.text: So how do you feel now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_080.text:
I'm...not sure. But it's not like I don't feel
anything at all. I do. It's just that whatever
I'm feeling is really hard to explain.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_000.text:
And there's an Epuyke Tablet fragment.
They feel the exact same as the husks
of our birth seeds, so I can always tell.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_010.text: Wait, you guys are born from SEEDS?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Wait, are you NOT!?
Eeeeeew! Groooss!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_030.text:
...KIDDING! Don't get all offended. You know, I wish you'd talk more about
yourself. Like, how you're born and
stuff like that? But I guess we don't
really have that kind of time, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_040.text:
But, um, hey. If I do actually manage
to become the Epuyke, will you...
tell my sister about your world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder what it says. The witness said
it'd be like reflecting on yourself, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_020.text:
What if it said, 'Ha ha! Just kidding!
You're not the maiden after all!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_040.text:
Well, I guess we'll just have to
put this thing together and see. 
Let's go back to the witness.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Chup, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Epi... Epa...? Uhhh...
Oh, right. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_000.text:
I don't think I can do this...
I wasn't the Epuyke's maiden after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Chup—but you
must not give up. All is according to the will
of the Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_020.text:
Aw, man! I thought the maidens could
quit halfway through if they wanted,
but I guess not. Can't believe you're making me go through
this whole thing even though you know
how much I suck at it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_030.text: You don't suck at this, Chup!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_050.text: Oh, forget it. Let's just go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_020.text:
It was all about my little sister—about how
she's always loved me even though all I've
ever done is cause problems for our family.
...I think I understand now why I was chosen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_050.text:
Hear me, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_020.text: It's a secret. One just for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Well then, on to the next.
You ready, Chup?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
What is the matter,
Soyay the Pollinator?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So she has run. Well, it is not as
though this is unprecedented.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_040.text:
If we cannot find the maiden before the
Epuyke withers, we will have no choice
but to graft.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Grafting involves choosing a substitute
from the maiden's direct family and
casting the spell on them.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Wait, so you don't just go pick
another maiden yourselves?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_080.text:
The maiden alone does not face the trials.
Tens of thousands of times have we repeated
the Epuyke ritual, and in that span we have
seen all manner of circumstances.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_090.text: What are you going to do, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_100.text:
We will cast the spell on the maiden's
little sister, Kup, and form her in a way
that is as close to Chup as possible.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_120.text:
I had been hoping the god of the Imeru might
choose Kup to begin with, for I feared exactly
this outcome. But alas, the ways of the divine
are mysterious, even to us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_130.text:
But Chup knows about the grafting, right?
She'd never run—she's not the kind of person
to saddle her sister with something like this
and then cut loose.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_200_CUT_000_140.text:
We can wait only until the Epuyke withers.
If she does not return before then,
Kup must be grafted.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_040.text:
You must stay here, Kup. We cannot
risk your running off as well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I trust you are familiar with the spell
of grafting? We are considering it as
a possible option.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_070.text:
She must have had a reason, though!
I know she'd never do anything to make
you sad.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No, it's all right. I'll be the maiden
if that's what Sis wants. But...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_090.text:
But before I do, I have to talk to her.
Please, Soyay. Find her for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_100.text:
Of course. I know she'll be back,
so just wait here, 'kay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_210_CUT_000_110.text:
Make haste, Soyay the Pollinator, for
you have only until the Epuyke withers.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_000.text:
Ugh, you found me ALREADY?
Seriously, what even are you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_010.text:
Okay, if you wanna run off somewhere,
you gotta TELL me! I was so worried!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
I just wanted to be alone, okay? I wanted to
think about how I might look as the Epuyke,
and how the whole thing might...feel. And I was really close to an answer,
but then YOU showed up! Ugh!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_220_CUT_000_030.text:
Hey, I get it, but we're outta time!
The clerics are going to graft Kup
if we don't get back to the village!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_010.text:
I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sooorry!
Your dumb big sister took a little detour,
and now everybody's lost their damn minds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_020.text:
Should the Epuyke vanish, Ancikar will begin
to awaken. You carry a great burden as the
Maiden of Epuyke, Chup—do you seek to have
this lifted from your shoulders?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_030.text:
Look, I wasn't running away, okay?
I just needed a little alone time. But I'm back now, so just leave
my sister out of this and let
me finish the stupid thing!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_221_CUT_000_060.text:
I got this, Kup. It's okay.
I'm your big sister, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_000.text:
There you are, Chup!
What are you doing here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_010.text:
Oh. Hey, Soyay. Sorry for taking off,
but I just had this random thought. So remember how I told you about the
pretty rocks when we came here? Well,
I wanted to find a nice one for Kup.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_020.text:
Well, that's a lovely thought—
except that they're gonna GRAFT HER
before you can give her the rock!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
What!? Oh, come on already!
Why doesn't anyone here TRUST me?
I mean, I was CHOSEN, remember!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, they don't really seem to care.
So c'mon unless you want Kup grafted!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_230_CUT_000_050.text:
But I still haven't found a good rock!
Search with me, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_010.text: But it's what we're looking for.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_020.text:
Man, it was a mistake asking you.
Are you really the Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, whoa... This is so pretty...
But isn't it a piece of an Ancikar fiend?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_231_CUT_000_040.text:
Nope. Just an eggshell. Now c'mon!
We gotta hurry back to the village!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_232_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_232_CUT_000_040.text:
Hey, Kup. So remember how we used to collect
rocks and I'd always take whatever you found?
I know it was a long time ago, but I'm still sorry.
So...I got you this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.text:
The Soyay helped me find it.
Pretty great, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.text:
Thank you, Sis.
I'll always treasure it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Chup,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.text:
I know. And if I'm going to bloom,
I'm going to be stunning—but I won't
be doing it for you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So what was the name of
this season's Epuyke maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.text:
The present Epuyke was once
an individual named Wakka.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.text:
So if I become the Epuyke, am I going
to be 'an individual once named Chup'?
Ugh. Can't say I feel good about that. Here's the deal: when I make the most
beautiful blossoms—and I am TOTALLY going
to make the most beautiful blossoms—
I want you to say 'Wooo! Chup rules!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Not NOW, you dingbat!
...But yeah, just like that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Hey, you've got me and Kup.
There's nothing to worry about!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
You make it sound like
it grew all on its own...

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.text:
This was fun when I was a kid, but now
I realize I didn't get it at ALL.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Boy, they're really going nuts...
I wonder if my pollen will taste
that good.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.text: Can pollen be good or bad, though?

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, I think they're just hungry.
C'mon, let's go.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
If you eat the pollen,
you turn into a Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.text:
I'm in the middle of my
trial thingies.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I'll do what I can, okay?
That's all I can really promise.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Chup!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Hey, know what I just realized, Soyay?
I never asked your real name.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Bwaaaaaa ha ha ha ha!
Oh man, that name is HILARIOUS! Er, but thanks for everything,
Ameya. Seriously.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No! Ancikar has possessed
the maiden's body!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
As we suspected, maidens who run from their
trials are tainted; I fear Ancikar has crept into
the crevices of her heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_010.text:
But Chup DIDN'T run!
She finished all her trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.text:
We must cut down that wicked blossom.
If we do not, Ancikar's power will spread
out across the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.text: Stop! Don't cut down my sister!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
