SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.text:
Listen to me, all of you! Me and Chup
can overcome ANY trial thrown at us,
and that's exactly what we're gonna do!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.text:
Kup, you keep calling Chup's name,
and let your Soyay save her!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.text:
Can't believe I came here to find a
cat and ended up getting involved
in all of this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.text: I hear you, Sis! It's me! Kup!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
I know you can hear your baby sister, Chup,
and I know you don't wanna make her cry!
You're way, WAY better than that, so don't
give in to Ancikar's dreams!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.text:
Though the wicked blossom has withered,
the Epuyke ritual has failed. What might
our god be thinking in all of this? I fear this
may portend the end of the world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.text:
Not yet. Chup is alive, and all the Ancikar
fiends we killed are going to be her strength.
She's going to blossom into a beautiful Epuyke!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.text:
Please trust in my sister.
Trust in the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.text:
We are guided by the Imeru god's will,
and so shall watch over the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.text:
Thank you, Kup...
I heard...your voice...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.text:
Not sure I was much of a guide, so...
I'm sorry, Chup.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.text:
Heh... You were a lousy Soyay...
But thanks anyway, Ameya...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.text:
I hope Chup blooms into
a beautiful flower.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 80,136th Soyay the Pollinator.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.text:
Hey, uh, do you think I could stay until
Chup—I mean, the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as
if for their very lives. What will you do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely a woman.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
80,137th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 80,136th Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_020.text: You can hear us, can't you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.text:
See, Chup? This is your pollen.
And since I'm your Soyay,
I'm going to take it with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Barely, I guess. But more importantly,
tell me what kind of world this is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.text:
Hey, I wasn't summoned!
I came here on my own!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.text:
Sure, fine. I'll let you have that.
So what do you want me to do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.text:
You sure you want to leave a job that
important in the hands of a rando
from some other world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. Alas, this season's maiden is quite the handful,
which is why I believe you have been summoned.
For of all possible Soyays in all the worlds,
you are best suited for this task.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.text:
God stuff aside, it sounds like you're
expecting a lot from me—and I'm gonna
do everything I can to live up to those
lofty expectations!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Now go forth and guide the maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Berta Village,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Heya! I'm Ameya Aisling, and I'm
gonna rock this Soyay thing!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Your greeting is recognized and appreciated.
I am called Yuk, and my daughter, Nana,
is who you will be guiding on her quest
to become a wonderful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Sorry! Sorry. Know I'm late—had to change,
what with me being the maiden and all.
Never really worn anything like this
before, but whatcha gonna do, am I right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.text:
Uh, look, I just got here, and so please
don't take this the wrong way, but...
are you REALLY the Epuyke maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.text:
I know! I know, I know, I know.
I don't look anything like Mom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Though our appearances differ, I raised Nana
as my daughter. Even our god can see she is
a proud Imeru on the inside, for this is why
she was granted the markings.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.text:
Kinda looks like you drew 'em on
yourself, if I'm being—

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.text:
Nope! I just woke up one morning
and BAM! Face markings. The village freaked out, because they couldn't
believe 'that Nana'—which is how they say my name,
by the way, super judgy—they couldn't believe
'that Nana' had been chosen to be the maiden. You should have seen their faces. Seriously,
like, EVERY jaw was dragging across the ground
and their eyes were all bugging out. It made
all this maiden business completely worth it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.text:
The god of the Imeru has chosen my daughter,
and though I know she will bloom into a most
beautiful Epuyke, I still remain uneasy.
So please, Soyay—guide her well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.text:
Well, I'd like to, but I have
no idea where to begin.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.text:
Okay, so basically I have to go pass three
trials: strength, wisdom, and love. As my Soyay,
you and me have to work together to overcome
them before the next Epuyke withers.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.text:
It's a big... Well, it's this... Look, it's gonna
be way easier to just show you, okay?
The Epuyke is gonna bloom while we're working
on the trials, so you can see it then. Cool?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_140.text: Neat! A little treat for later.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.text:
Then let's quit standing here
and get going already! C'mon!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Please take care of my Nana,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.text:
Okay, so let me introduce myself again:
I'm Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke. And this part I didn't want to say in front
of Mom, but I wasn't born in this world.
I mean, obviously, but figured I should just
get it all out there anyway, you know? Yeah, so I came here with another Soyay,
but when they left me behind, Mom decided
to raise me as her own. That's the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.text:
Anyway, apparently the Soyay who brought me
here wore these clothes, and for some reason
Mom insisted I wear them on my trials.
So that's why I'm dressed like this. Oh hey! Once the Epuyke ritual is over,
do you think I'll go back to the world
that Soyay came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.text: Uh, do you WANT to go back?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.text:
I dunno. I mean, I'd LOVE to get out there
and visit strange worlds, you know?
But I'm also from here, so I can't
imagine living out there forever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.text:
Anyway, now you know the whole story.
So be my guide, Soyay, and be a good one.
Let's go do this thing! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.text:
Wowzers, that girl talked my ear off
and then just bolted. Are all the people
in this world like that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you know what this
trial entails, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.text:
The Trial of Wisdom is a test of one's wisdom,
knowledge, and discretion, and is undertaken
to determine whether or not a maiden is suited
to become the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.text:
I am pleased to see you were not raised by
Yuk with nothing to show for it. That said,
the Trial of Wisdom also reaffirms your
connection with the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.text:
So I'll be looking back on the
time I've spent here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.text:
If I may speak plainly, we are all
rather perplexed as to why the god
of the Imeru has chosen you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Okay, seriously? I've got TONS of memories
with the land, which the god of the Imeru
would totally know. I am an Imeru, just like
everyone else. It isn't that hard.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.text:
This is true—and yet, we cannot help but
look at the differences which separate you
from the rest of our kind. Perhaps this is a revelation from the god of
the Imeru asking us to be more considerate of
what lies inside? Regardless, I pray you might 
overcome the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_080.text:
So am I the only one who has no
idea what the heck she's supposed
to be doing here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.text:
She must collect fragments of the Epuyke Tablet
which have been scattered across the land,
put them back together, and decipher the tale
written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.text:
Oh, I'm going to decipher it, all right—
and when I do, you'll see that my heart
is no different from yours!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.text:
We don't know where the fragments are
or how many we're looking for, so I
assume that's all part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.text:
You have seen the truth of it, Soyay.
Now go find the fragments and return to me.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Look! A fragment of the Epuyke Tablet!
Oh, and there's a pattern carved on it!
Am I supposed to decipher this? Really?
Because I have ZERO idea what I'm looking at.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Ooo, you're right! I feel some kind
of strange power coming from it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Yeah, so I've heard the tablet is actually
born at the same time the maiden appears?
It grows up from the ground just like this. Some people say the dreams of the Ancikar are
carved into it, but other people say it actually
contains a divine message from the Imeru god.
Truth is, nobody knows for sure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, and I was also told the fragments would
appear in places that are important to me,
but I've never even BEEN to this place before,
so that's just weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Mom used to bring me here sometimes—she'd
stare at the Epuyke and then cry all quietly.
I'd always pretend not to notice, because I
just had a feeling I wasn't supposed to ask.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.text:
I heard the Epuyke keeps everything here
alive, right? I suppose it makes sense Yuk
has some memories relating to it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, maybe. You know, I thought a lot about
the maidens and how they must've felt when they
became the Epuyke. Were they embarrassed to have
everyone staring at them? Or were they proud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.text: Still, even with all that thinking, I never imagined I'd be chosen to be the maiden. Always figured it'd be someone else's problem.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_060.text: How's it feel being a maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.text:
I dunno. I just wonder if Mom's gonna look
at me and cry once I turn into the Epuyke.
That's all I can think about right now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh wow, this is the same as our birth-seed husks!
See, whenever an Imeru is born, the parents save
the husk and turn it into some kind of accessory
the kids can wear around.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.text:
But I never got an accessory—and when I asked Mom
why, she didn't know how to answer. Of course,
now I know it's because I wasn't born from a seed,
but at the time it made zero sense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Anyway, one day she brought out this super old
husk from the storehouse and said it was mine,
but I knew that wasn't true. So I burst out
crying and she just kind of...stood there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_050.text:
I gave my own mom plenty to worry about,
so I know where you're coming from.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.text:
Later, I went to the storehouse and found
the box where the husk was stored. The name
'Nuy' was written on it, but I've never
gotten up the guts to ask Mom who that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.text:
...Wow. I've never told anyone that
story before. I suppose this means
I really trust you, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.text:
I really appreciate it, Nana.
It'll be our little secret!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder what it says? It'd be nice if
it proves what you are on the inside
just like you said it would.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh, I was just irritated by the stuff she
was saying—I'm a whole lot calmer now.
Honestly, whatever's written on the tablet
isn't going to surprise me. Probably.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.text:
Yeah, I doubt ANYTHING would surprise you
more than becoming the Epuyke maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Nana, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.text:
As your witness, I was unsure if the tablet
fragments would grow—or if your Soyay would
even be able to find them. But the will of the Imeru god is ever wise,
and I am relieved to see you were able to
complete the trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.text:
You know, people have always said terrible
things about me behind my back—called me an
animal and worse. And Mom... Well, you don't
even want to KNOW the things they said to her. But you know what? Screw 'em. I'm gonna
become the Epuyke and bless this land
no matter WHAT they all think of me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, who am I kidding!? I can't do this!
I'm not an Imeru, I don't have a husk—
there's no WAY I can put this together! Clearly, the god of the Imeru just gave
me these markings as a punishment.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Nana—you must
not give up. All is according to the will of the
Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.text:
Yeah, listen to the witness! No one
said anything about punishing you,
so there's no reason to give up!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.text:
Sorry. I'm sorry.
Just lost myself a bit.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.text: I can't do it. There's no way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.text:
Okay, so I read the tablet, and it
told me to go to the Kieru Ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.text:
I see. You may reach the ruins by taking the
branching path managed by the Kikir in the
cavern that connects to Doroso Village.
I will notify the Kikir to expect you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.text:
Is the next part of the trial
going to these ruins?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.text:
No. The trial ended when the maiden finished
deciphering the tablet. Whether or not you
choose to follow the tablet's instruction
is up to the two of you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.text:
Do you know what the
Kieru Ruins are like?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.text:
I don't know—I've never been.
The Kikir manage that area,
so the Imeru don't go there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.text:
So what's the plan here, Nana?
Should we go to the ruins first,
or put the maiden business first?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.text:
The tablet is a revelation from the god of the
Imeru—and though I am not Imeru, I know I was
given these markings for a reason, so I feel
like I have to do as the tablet says...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.text: So let's go find the ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the Epuyke ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.text:
I'll do what I can, but I just don't know
how this is going to turn out.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator! I hear the revelation on the Epuyke Tablet
bid you come to this place. This will be an
inconvenience to the people of Doroso Village,
but they will simply have to make their peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.text:
The path is connected—please go ahead.
Also, so far as I know, there is nothing
within the Kieru Ruins, but I trust it is
important to you. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Since this is a ruin, it means
someone lived here once.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.text: Do you mind if I walk ahead?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Well, okay. But scream real loud
if you need help, got it?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—there's something
written on it that I can't read. I think it may
have belonged to a past Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.text: Is that a book? Let me see.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_030.text:
I don't know this language, but I can
just cast my translation magic on it
and we'll be in business.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_050.text:
'May 3rd...' It must be a diary,
and I assume that's a date?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.text:
'For reasons unclear, I have been summoned
to this world by some sort of magic. I am apparently
meant to walk with someone labeled a 'maiden'
and aid her in a series of trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.text:
But I have only a few days supply
of both diapers and milk remaining,
and I don't know what to do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.text:
I was right! This WAS left
by a previous Soyay!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.text:
'When I awoke, I thought for a moment this
 had all been a dream, but it was not to be.
Time is...strange here—fluid—which is why
I have decided to write all of this down.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.text:
The easiest way to return to my world is to 
abandon the maiden, but am torn as to whether
or not this is an ethical decision to make. I have no one else to talk to.
I don't know what to do.
I cannot leave Nana alone.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.text:
'I spoke to the clerics; the maiden's
mother will look after Nana while I'm off
helping her daughter on the trials. I know Nuy will not return home if I am
successful, and yet I still feel this is
something I must do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.text:
Look, I'll stop reading if you
don't want to hear any more.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.text:
'Today, I set out on my trials
with the maiden, Nuy. Her mother, Yuk, will be taking care of Nana
while I'm away—and even though Yuk's own
daughter is going to become the Epuyke,
all she does is fuss over me and Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't know much about this world, but I do
know this: Yuk is a good person—even though
I would lose my mind if someone told me
Nana had to become this Epuyke thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.text:
When these trials are over—when we return
to our world and Nana grows up—I'll tell
her about everything that happened here. She's probably going to think I'm making
it up—or that I'm mad—and I won't be able
to blame her for either one. Perhaps I'll even write a book about
this place one day—I imagine it would
sell quite well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.text:
Oh, one last thing: I learned to say 'Epuyke
nogonoa kowo' in the local dialect. People say
this to me constantly, and it roughly means,
'May the blossoms of the Epuyke watch over you.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.text:
Well, it's time for me to go.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo, my precious Nana.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_250.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_250.text:
We came here like the tablet told us to
and found this diary. Seems like the
Imeru god's will is the real thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.text:
Aw, Nana! You're crying!
Did I say something wrong?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.text:
I don't know... I have no idea how I'm
supposed to feel after hearing all that!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.text:
Yeah, I'm better—but we're heading back 
to the village. I'm done pretending I don't
know about any of this, and it's time to
hear what Mom has to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—do you know
what it is? I think it may have belonged
to a past Soyay, because it's definitely
not from this world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_020.text:
Well, staring at it isn't helping,
so let's hit the button!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.text:
FILE GREEN 105:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.text:
The residents claim the Epuyke flower
purifies the dreams of an evil deity
they call Ancikar. But if we assume that to be true, surely this
evil god would consider the process of a maiden
becoming the flower and absorbing its power
to be an act of aggression.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.text:
But no hostile relationship can last forever,
so perhaps this is better thought of as kind
of forced symbiosis where both the maiden
and Ancikar gain something.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.text:
FILE GREEN 080:
QUESTIONABILITY OF ANCIKAR'S EXISTENCE

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.text: Has any resident actually seen the evil deity Ancikar? The clerics refuse to answer when I ask to see records of its awakening—or to even confirm such records exist at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.text:
Perhaps Ancikar is not a living being at all,
but instead a metaphor for natural phenomena—
one which serves much the same purpose as dragons
and demons in the myths of other worlds. If so, there would be records of eruptions,
floods, and the like—and these things would
still be happening.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.text:
The Imeru have a magical civilization mature
enough to summon ritual attendants from other
worlds, yet continue carrying out an arcane
practice where one of them becomes the Epuyke. It is a truly fascinating dichotomy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.text:
FILE GREEN 208:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #36

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.text:
Let us assume for the moment the hypothesis
that the maiden does not absorb and purify
Ancikar's magic is correct. Perhaps, then, in exchange for receiving the
maiden's life force in the form of her soul,
Ancikar returns that same force to the earth
in the form of energy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.text:
FILE GREEN 005:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #908

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.text:
What if Ancikar does not exist as an individual
being, but is instead an aggregate of all the
sacrificed maidens' souls? How much remorse
and anger would such a creature possibly hold?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.text:
And what if the Maiden's Garden—the place
said to be the destination for the souls
of all maidens who become the Epuyke—
is Ancikar itself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.text:
I came here by chance as an inspector,
and have been attempting to examine my
hypotheses and speculations from the
viewpoint of a rational scholar. And yet, there is a mythical makeup
to this world that science, biology,
and even folklore cannot fully explain.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.text: An example of this is how those who ingest the Epuyke's pollen are unable to leave this world. ...But it tasted so good.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.text:
I believe roughly 50,000 cycles of base time have
passed since I arrived. And while many others—
called Pollinators—have been summoned here, there
have been no other inspectors from the base. This is most unfortunate. Sadly, there's little
I can do other than leave this here in the hopes
that another of my kind will eventually find
their way here and read it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't understand any of that.
What were they trying to say?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.text:
Whoever that was clearly spent
WAY too long alone with their
own thoughts in this world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.text: But I'm curious about one thing: Do you believe that the maidens of the Epuyke are Ancikar?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.text:
No. No, that's not possible. I mean,
it would be the gravest of insults to
think of the maidens as evil. I mean, sure, waking up one morning with markings
that mean you're now a maiden is probably hard to
accept for some people. But the idea it leads to
a grudge? To some kind of...eternal rage? No. Whoever wrote all of that clearly
doesn't understand the Imeru at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.text:
Then this must be a trial; a test to see how I,
as your Soyay, will face you, the Epuyke's maiden.
It's telling me to think about how I should look
at you, Nana. I think that's what it means.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.text:
So how WILL you deal with me,
Soyay? What will you do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.text:
That's something I'll find out at the end.
Right now, I'm busy fulfilling my role as
your Soyay, so Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.text:
There are so many things I want to talk
to you about, Mom, but I don't even
know where to... I mean...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.text:
We found Hasumi's diary in the Kieru ruins.
There were a lot of revelations for Nana
in there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Is that so? I was unaware Hasumi
left any records behind... Yes, well, let me start from the beginning.
This is all from memory, mind, so it might differ
slightly from Hasumi's diary, but believe me
when I say I have no intention to deceive you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.text:
It's okay, Mom. I know you're
not that kind of person.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Nuy received the markings of the maiden when
she was younger than Nana is now. Everyone was
delighted to have a maiden from Berta Village,
and our family doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.text:
Soon, the Soyay arrived—that was Hasumi—
with a baby in her arms. The child was
far different than Imeru seedlings,
but adorable all the same.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.text:
None of us had ever heard of a Soyay with a baby,
including the clerics. Seeing them at a loss for
how to handle the situation, I offered to care
for the child—for you, Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.text:
Nuy and Hasumi left soon thereafter
on the journey of trials, but along
the way, Hasumi...she perished.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.text:
Yet Nuy managed through to the end
and bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke—
one filled both with her own spirit
and the steadfast heart of Hasumi.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.text:
Hasumi left this for me before she departed,
and told me to give this to Nana should
anything happen. I should have done this
much sooner, but... Well, here it is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.text:
I'm pretty sure this is a photograph—
a moment in time reflected on paper. The person holding the baby looks a lot
like you, Nana, so that must be Hasumi.
But wow, there are so many other people
in this picture, too!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.text:
I raised you in Hasumi's stead.
It was difficult, since you are
not Imeru, but I could not bear
the thought of losing you. That's why I never showed you this
picture: because if you saw it and
chose to leave, I...I couldn't...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.text: I know how hard you worked for me, Mom, and I'm truly, truly grateful. Without you, I would have been dead a long time ago. So no matter what I learn and no matter what I see, I will always be your little girl.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.text:
But I do have one question:
why did you dress me in my
birth-mother's clothes?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.text:
I thought the god of the Imeru might
have chosen you as the maiden so you could
return to your original world, and... Well, I suppose I just
wanted you to fit in.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.text:
I'm Imeru, Mom—I wouldn't have the faintest
IDEA what to do if I was thrown back into my
own world after all this time. I think the
god of the Imeru understands that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.text:
So you're going to keep on
as the Epuyke maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.text:
Even though I'm very confused about what
the Imeru god wants from me, I'm going
to do what I am meant to do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.text: I love you, Mom. Epuyke nogonoa kowo.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Do you understand the relationship
between Ancikar and the Epuyke, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Sure do! The Epuyke transforms the evil god
Ancikar's dreams into blessings for the land,
keeping Ancikar asleep and protecting us all
from his wickedness.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak true. Then tell me, do you
understand the relationship between
the Imeru and the Kikir?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
The Imeru provide the Maiden of
the Epuyke, while the Kikir fight
Ancikar's fiends. Some Imeru think the Kikir don't do anything,
but that's wrong. All of them put their lives
on the line every day for this world's
peace and prosperity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
My mom's been teaching me about all of this
since I was young; she wanted to make sure
I understood this world better than anyone.
And I was interested in the Kikir anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I expect no less from Yuk. She comes from
a line of exceptional maidens, and raised you
to be a fine individual. This is doubtless why
you were chosen to be the maiden!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I know many Imeru who have strong opinions on
your being a maiden, but we Kikir mind not the
differences between you and the maidens of the
past. We care only that you believe in yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.text:
Lead the Epuyke's maiden well, Soyay
the Pollinator. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text:
This is where we're going
to have our trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text:
Know that many Soyay lives have
been forfeited in this very trial,
so do not let your guard down. I shall now summon the fiend...
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator! You have done very well in your trial,
and I pray you might become the Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
You are Hasumi's daughter,
are you not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: So it seems. Is that a problem?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Those of us who aid in the Epuyke's trials
do not record the names of either maidens
or Soyay, for to do so may lead to doubts
over the Imeru god's choices.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
However, no summoner of strength could
ever forget the names of Hasumi or Nuy,
because it is they who taught us the true
meaning of the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
We believed the trial of strength was simply
a way to test the Soyay's physical prowess.
We thought there was only meaning in victory. Alas, our thinking was shallow;
the significance of the trial
runs far, far deeper.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: Though Hasumi lost her life in the trial, her heart was bound to Nuy—and consequently, Nuy bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke. So you see, the true significance of this trial is to test the bond between the hearts of the maiden and her Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator.
I expect your hearts to find their
true bond through this trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
All right, it's dead!
Feel bonded to me, yet?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I'm not sure about that, but I DO know
I wanted you to win more than anything! Still, I'm sure Nuy was thinking the same
thing when she watched Hasumi fight,
and Hasumi ended up losing anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I know Hasumi must have apologized to her;
I could tell from what we read in the diary.
She must have felt awful not being able
to guide Nuy to the very end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Felt awful? How could she feel AWFUL!?
She gave her own LIFE for Nuy—
what more could she do!? I mean, what are the people who get left
behind even supposed to DO with that?
Hell, maybe the only choice is to
risk my own life and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
It's okay, Nana. I'm alive.
There's no burden for you to bear.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I have just witnessed a miracle: Hasumi's heart
has crossed the boundaries of time to bond with
her daughter. I will now cherish and care for
this trial even more. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in
the holes upon the plateaus.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Um... Aren't you going to ask
me the meaning of this trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.text:
What meaning the maiden assigns to
this trial is left to her discretion. What meaning is there in choosing the holes?
In spreading the seeds? In Ancikar's fiends?
In the very vines themselves? I would have you think on all these
things with a heart full of love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.text:
This looks like a seed hole.
You like this one, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_000.text: Okay, that's the last of the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.text:
I've always tried to picture what
kind of seed I sprouted from. I mean, I figure it's different from most
other people's, so I always imagined it 
as being sort of transparent and shiny.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.text:
Uh, humans aren't born from seeds.
You grew in your mom's stomach.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.text:
WHAAAT!? But if you sprouted from your
mom's stomach, that means she DIED!
Nuh-uh, no way! Keep your creepy
world the hell away from me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_040.text:
You're definingly missing something here,
but sure thing. Whatever you say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.text:
That was an Ancikar fiend, which should
be enough nutrients for the seeds.
It just needs to sprout now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.text:
So what meaning is there in the vines, huh?
I mean, I've been thinking with a loving heart
like I'm supposed to, but I can't see anything
but...you know. Vines. Is this what it's like to become
the Epuyke? It seems so superficial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.text:
You know, I've never planted seeds before.
If I wanted to grow plants, I'd use magic.
But there's something cool about bringing
life to the future with our own hands.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.text:
That's the first Soyay-like thing you've
ever said to me! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Nana,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Aren't you nervous because
I'm not Imeru?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.text:
You have been chosen by the god of the Imeru.
To find unease in this fact would be to show
distrust and insult to our deity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.text:
You were raised here. You are Imeru.
We expect great things from you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.text:
And I'm gonna do everything I can
to live up to those expectations!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.text:
It didn't grow out of the ground
itself... There was a maiden...

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_030.text: Have you ever had it before?

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Only people who want seeds eat pollen.
I'm, uh...not old enough for that yet.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Become the Epuyke!
Feed us tasty pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.text: Do you think I can do that?

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.text:
Absolutely! I know you'll shower
us with tasty, tasty pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_AMYA_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.text: I'm working on my trials now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.text:
So I'm absolutely going to do my
best here, but I have one request: When I become the Epuyke, will you please
look after Mom? I want her to live the
rest of her life without worry.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Worry not, she will be treated very well.
Relatives of the Epuyke are valuable—and as
she raised you to be the Maiden of the Epuyke,
her experience is doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.text: Well, you're right about that: Mom is an exceptional Imeru.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.text:
We pray you will bloom into an
equally exceptional Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Nana!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.text:
I finally feel like I can do this, Soyay—
and if I DO manage to become the Epuyke,
it'll all be because of you. So...thanks.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_060.text:
You'll be totally fine, girl!
You can do this!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.text:
If I manage to become the Epuyke, it's
all going to be because of you, Soyay.
Thanks for everything you did for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.text:
You're right. I feel like...
I can do this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.text: So Nana really became the Epuyke...

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.text:
I questioned the Imeru god's choice at first,
just as I did when her mother was summoned as
the Soyay—but I see now all was done according
to our god's great plan. Praise be to mother and daughter!
Praise be to Soyay and Epuyke!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.text:
Do you think I'll be able to bloom
into the Epuyke? I mean, I haven't
actually done ANYTHING!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.text:
It will not work. The ritual is a failure.
Ancikar refuses to accept a maiden
that is not Imeru!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.text:
I couldn't do it, Soyay! I'm useless!
My body is useless and I can't change it!
Why did the Imeru god even choose me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.text: I will graft in her place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.text:
Return to your people, Nana.
This is the will of the Imeru god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.text:
Indeed. Ancikar will most
certainly accept Yuk.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.text:
There's no time!
Come, Yuk! This way!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.text:
That animal body was quite convenient for
Ancikar, was it not? Indeed, Ancikar has never
before manifested in this manner!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.text:
Okay, I want all the clerics
and gods and whoever else
is in earshot to listen up! Nana isn't EVER going to fail one
of these trials, and neither am I!
Now shut up and watch how it's done!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.text:
You hear me, Nana!? I need your help—
the help of the Epuyke maiden!
I need you to fight with me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.text:
A great deal of Ancikar's power was necessary
to transform Maiden Nana into the Epuyke;
the god of the Imeru summoned a most
powerful Soyay for this very reason.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_020.text:
Oh, this was all Nana. It was her heart
that beat back Ancikar's dreams.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.text:
Indeed, we stand corrected:
this Epuyke had a heart more
like an Imeru than any other.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.text:
Nana really became the Epuyke, huh?
You are Imeru, Nana—you always have been.
And you're going to be a beautiful flower.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator. I now pronounce
you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.text:
Could I stay until Nana—I mean,
until the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.text:
I can't really put it into words, but
I feel like I have to be here for this—
for the moment an alien presence
becomes part of this world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.text:
You are now merely a woman, and we
cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
1,080,363rd Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.text:
But we have one thing for you.
The Epuyke was clad in these.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.text:
...Nana's clothes?
No. Give them to Yuk.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 1,080,362nd Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.text:
You will always be Nana's Soyay—
and as such, I would like you
to take these when you go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.text:
She chose to live her life as an Imeru,
but I believe she harbored a wish in
her heart to see other worlds. So please
take at least a part of her with you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.text:
You hear that, Nana?
We're off to see other worlds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.text:
So does the Imeru god have a thing
for crummy endings like this?
'Cause I feel SUPER lousy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.text:
A question we hope to ask the god ourselves,
for never once has a Soyay so irresponsible
ever been summoned to us. But enough of this—we must begin the
trials for the next maiden and Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator, and I now
pronounce you freed from your duty. Now please leave.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_030.text: Don't need to tell me twice!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_050.text:
An apology from the Imeru god, eh?
Not sure how much it means considering
I don't believe in gods, but whatever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.text:
I sure hope you're okay with this, Mom.
I mean, at least you'll have company,
since Nuy is in the Maiden's Garden. I know now that Nuy's my older sister,
and I really hope you both find peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.text:
I miss you, Mom, and I...
I don't know what I'm going
to do without you. *sniff*

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_020.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_020.text:
Yuk's only returned to the earth, Nana.
She'll be watching over you forever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.text: What is it, Mom? Did you see Nuy?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.text:
She's gone to the Maiden's Garden...
I sure hope she's happy getting to
see Nuy again after all this time.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_000.text:
Thank you for everything, Soyay.
I mean it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.text:
I'm not the Soyay anymore—I'm Ameya Aisling.
Er, but what are you going to do now, Nana?
I mean, 'cause if you don't have big plans,
you could come see other worlds with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_030.text: I'm an Imeru. My place is here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.text:
Mom wanted me to leave this world once my
trials were done, so that's what I'm gonna do!
Er, I mean, if that's all right with you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.text:
Thanks, but I'm Imeru, and I need
to protect my mom's lineage. One day, I'll eat the Epuyke's pollen,
harbor a seed inside me, and raise a
maiden like Nuy. I just hope I can
do it all as good as Mom did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.text:
Oh, but I don't need these clothes
anymore, so you can have them. And if you ever get the chance,
I'd love for you to take them to my
birth-mother's world. But for now,
Epuyke nogonoa kowo, Ameya!

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.text:
See, Nana? This is your pollen.
And since I'm your Soyay,
I'm going to take it with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RETURN_999_CUT_000_000.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W11_EVAR_AMYA_RETURN_999_CUT_000_000.text:
Taking the Epuyke's pollen is the
only thing that makes sense, right?
